problem: Crew members need assistance in planning routes, and there is currently no feature to suggest a sample route for them to follow.
scope: Implement a button in the crew interface that, when clicked, suggests a predefined sample route for the crew to consider.
acceptance_criteria: A 'Suggest Route' button is visible in the crew interface.
Clicking the 'Suggest Route' button displays a predefined sample route.
The suggested route is visually distinct (e.g., highlighted or marked) on the map or route planning interface.
The crew can accept or ignore the suggested route without affecting other functionalities.
The feature is responsive and works across different screen sizes and devices.
tasks: Design the UI for the 'Suggest Route' button and place it in the crew interface.
Define a sample route dataset or algorithm to generate a route for suggestion.
Implement the backend logic to fetch or generate the sample route when the button is clicked.
Integrate the frontend to display the suggested route on the map or route planning interface.
Add functionality to allow the crew to accept or ignore the suggested route.
Ensure the feature is responsive and compatible with different devices and screen sizes.
Write unit tests for the backend route suggestion logic.
Write integration tests for the button click and route display functionality.
test_plan: Test 1: Verify that the 'Suggest Route' button is visible and clickable in the crew interface across different devices.
Test 2: Confirm that clicking the button triggers the display of a sample route.
Test 3: Validate that the suggested route is visually distinct on the map or interface.
Test 4: Ensure the crew can accept or ignore the route without impacting other features.
Test 5: Test responsiveness by checking the feature on various screen sizes and devices.
Test 6: Run unit tests to verify backend logic for route suggestion.
Test 7: Run integration tests to confirm the button and route display work seamlessly.
